meta.name: DESCRIPTION
meta.content: Kalamazoo Public Schools, home of the Kalamazoo Promise, is a progressive full service Pre-K--12 school district. It serves over 13,000 students in 4 high schools, 5 middle schools, and 17 elementary schools.

meta.name: KEYWORDS
meta.content: Kalamazoo Public Schools, Kalamazoo Promise, High School, Middle School, Elementary School

h1.a: Click here to access The Learning Hub, online educational resources for students and families.
Information on Grab and Go Meal Distribution.

header.p: All Kalamazoo Public Schools Buildings Are Closed For the Remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year.
Food Service Grab and Go Meal Distribution Will Continue As Planned Until Further Notice.
Letters of Intent or other items may be dropped off in the mail slot next to the sideentrance of the Administration Building.
Please Check Back Here and On Our Facebook Page for Further Updates.

img.alt: Longtime Singer Plans a New Way to Use Her Voice

article.h3: KPS Working to Provide Supports to Students

div.p: KPS will continue offering lunches and resources at the online Learning Hub.

article.div: Resources to help students stay engaged and learning during the mandatory school shut down.

article.h3: Program Will Provide 'Grab and Go" Meals Indefinitely

div.p: Distribution will take place three days a week and provide meals for seven days.

article.h3: Administration Building Closing to Public Visitors

div.p: District has instituted a mobile food service, online learning hub during school closure.

div.p:
Any student, prospective student, employee or guest of the District who is unable to access information contained on this website or any online content about the District's programs, services, or activities may contact a member of the District Communications Department for assistance. Susan Coney, Director of Communications, (269) 337-1572, coneysl@kalamazoopublicschools.net.
